item.title: Diaries of Tom Turley
item.description: Mother was crying again. She tried to be quiet, but I heard. I will never get used to the sound. Why must she always be sad? Didn’t she wed father for love? I wonder if they had it better before me. Father came to see me goodnight. He sat on my bedside, telling me one of his stories. His gaze often left my face. I could see in his eyes, that he was dreaming of the sea.
